page.title: 13SERVICES
page.content: There is only one shop in our block. It is the Post Office, which sells all sorts of things, at Greenham. To reach it you have to climb up lots of steps up a very steep hillside. Brian the baker brings bread and cakes in his van and there is also a fish van. Untreated milk is delivered by a local farm but there is also a Co-op van which brings pastuerised milk and also sells eggs. A library van brings books every three weeks. Every Monday the doctor comes from Wellington and holds a surgery in Ashbrittle Village Hall for people who cannot get to Wellington where there is a Health Centre. There are only two buses a week. They both go to Wellington. The Tuesday bus is quite useful but the Wednesday bus takes ages to get there.
